intro: Asarum muramatsui, commonly known as Japanese wild betony, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and unique, hooded flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow with a strong, musky odor, which attracts specific pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
